newsitem.title: CYPRUS: Freak Cyprus storms kill one, cause damage.
newsitem.headline: Freak Cyprus storms kill one, cause damage.

text.p: Freak hailstorms coupled with strong winds killed one person and caused substantial damage to buildings in southeastern Cyprus on Tuesday, police said.
Winds ripped roofs off homes, in some cases causing water tanks to crash onto parked vehicles at villages in the Famagusta district on the south eastern coast of the island.
A 44-year-old man was killed when the ceiling in his bedroom caved in and a water tank crushed him, police said.
Unstable weather on the island is set to continue over the next three days, the meteorological department said.
"It is normal weather for this time of year," director Kleanthis Philaniotis told Reuters.
